00005 #include <iostream>

00032 template <class T> int Tmycpy( T a, T b, size_t size, int numElements)
00033 {
00034   //set the number of elements copied to the initial 1 (an unconditional
00035   //copy is performed later on)
00036   int count = 1;
00037 
00038   //print out the array using the numElements
00039   std::cout << "INITIAL ARRAY CONTENTS: " << "a=" ;
00040   for(int i=0; i < numElements; i++)
00041     std::cout << a[i];
00042 
00043   std::cout << "|b=";
00044 
00045   for(int i=0; i < numElements; i++)
00046     std::cout << b[i];
00047   
00048   std::cout << "|"
00049             << "size=" << size
00050             << "|"
00051             << "numElements=" << numElements
00052             << std::endl;
00053 
00054   //range check the arrays
00055   //if( ! sizeof(b) >= sizeof(a))
00056     //return -1;
00057 
00058   //create a couple of pointers (assuming we can -if we passed a
00059   //reference we might be in trouble --> type checking and
00060   //specialization might be a better option for this template...)
00061   T p1 =a;
00062   T p2 =b; 
00063 
00064   //do an unconditional copy until a NULL Terminator is found
00065   //(inclusive) and count the elements copied
00066   while(*p2++ = *p1++)
00067     count++;
00068 
00069   //compare the arrays
00070   if(memcmp(static_cast<void *>(a), static_cast<void *>(b), size) != 0)
00071     return -1;
00072 
00073   //return number of elements copied
00074   return count;
00075 }
00076   
00077 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00078 {
00079   //string literal copy to a character array
00080 
00081   char ca1[] = {"123456789"};
00082   char ca2[sizeof(ca1)];        // create an array that is the size of
00083                                 // ca1.
00084 
00085   memset(ca2, 'x', sizeof(ca2)); // set the contents of ca2 to a bunch
00086                                  // of char 'x' so we can "watch" what
00087                                  // happens.
00088 
00089   //call our template function
00090   int i = Tmycpy<char *>(ca1, ca2, sizeof(ca2), sizeof(ca2)/sizeof(char));
00091 
00092   //check the data
00093   if(i != -1)
00094     std::cout << "SUCCESS: " 
00095               << "ca1=" << ca1
00096               << "|" 
00097               << "ca2=" << ca2 
00098               << "|" 
00099               << "elements copied=" << i
00100               << std::endl;
00101 
00102   std::cout << "#############################" << std::endl;
00103 
00104   // int array copy (upto a found \0)
00105   int ia[] = {9,8,7,6,5,4,3,2,1,0};
00106   int ib[] = {0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,4}; // initialize to all \0 and a 4 at
00107                                     // the end -for range checking
00108                                     // demonstration purposes in the
00109                                     // template
00110 
00111   //call our template function to make the copy
00112   i = Tmycpy<int *>(ia, ib, sizeof(ib), sizeof(ib)/sizeof(*ib));
00113                                                     
00114                                                    
00115   //check status and display contents
00116   if(i != -1)
00117     std::cout << "SUCCESS: int array works too" 
00118               << "|" 
00119               << "elements copied=" << i
00120               << std::endl;
00121 
00122   std::cout << "SECOND ARRAY CONTENTS: " << "ia=" ;
00123   for(int j=0; j < i; j++)
00124     std::cout << ia[j];
00125 
00126   std::cout << "|ib=";
00127 
00128   for(int j=0; j < i; j++)
00129     std::cout << ib[j];
00130   
00131   std::cout << std::endl;
00132 
00133   std::cout << "#############################" << std::endl;

00135   //return success
00136   return 0;
